title: Iran Defense Minister : West behind terror attacks in Russia , Iran
message:
Iranian Defense Minister Mohammad Reza Ashtiani said that terrorist attacks in Iran and Russia recently "are the result of the support of Western countries, especially the United States, to terrorist groups," the Iranian government's semi-official Mehr News Agency reported last Saturday.
While the article did not reveal which terror groups were being referenced by Ashtiani, both Russia and Iran have been the target of attacks by ISIS in recent months.
Similarly, in January, ISIS orchestrated an explosion in Kerman, Iran, which killed close to 100 people.
Smoke rises above the burning Crocus City Hall concert venue following a reported shooting incident, outside Moscow, Russia, March 22, 2024.
While Israel has not publicly admitted to have orchestrated the strike, an anonymous Israeli official told Reuters that those eliminated had "been behind many attacks on Israeli and American assets and had plans for additional attacks."
event_breakdown:
- Iranian Defense Minister Mohammad Reza Ashtiani accuses Western countries, especially the United States, of supporting terrorist groups
- Iran and Russia have been targeted by ISIS attacks
- ISIS orchestrated an explosion in Kerman, Iran in January, killing close to 100 people
- Smoke rises above the burning Crocus City Hall concert venue following a shooting incident outside Moscow, Russia
- An anonymous Israeli official reveals that individuals eliminated in the Crocus City Hall incident had plans for attacks on Israeli and American assets

title: Nato chief chides members as Ukraine allies say slow arms deliveries have helped Russia
message:
Outgunned, Ukraine’s troops have struggled to fend off Russian advances on the battlefield.
“Serious delays in support have meant serious consequences on the battlefield” for Ukraine, Nato Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg told a news conference in Kyiv with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
Drawn-out Ukrainian efforts to mobilise more troops, and the belated building of battlefield fortifications, are other factors undermining Ukraine’s war effort, military analysts say.
The Russian military is in a better position at the moment.
“Russian forces remain unlikely to achieve a deeper operationally significant penetration in the area in the near term,” the Institute for the Study of War said in an assessment Sunday.
event_breakdown:
1. Ukraine’s troops struggling to fend off Russian advances on the battlefield
2. Nato Secretary General Stoltenberg expressing concerns over delays in support for Ukraine
3. Ukrainian efforts to mobilize more troops and build battlefield fortifications facing challenges
4. The Russian military currently having a stronger position
5. Assessment from the Institute for the Study of War stating that Russian forces are unlikely to achieve significant penetration in the near term

title: Israel strikes Hamas rocket launchers , tunnel shafts
message:
Shortly afterwards, fighter jets struck operational tunnel shafts, an anti-tank missile launch post and terror infrastructure in the area of northern Gaza from which the launch was identified.
Troops identified numerous terrorists at the location from which the launches were fired, and fighter jets struck and eliminated the terrorists.
During operational activity in central Gaza, two terrorists were identified advancing toward the troops in the area.
Fighter jets struck the structure, eliminating the terrorist.
Also, fighter jets struck Hezbollah terrorist infrastructure in the areas of Kfarkela and Khiam in southern Lebanon.
location: The main location where the main event took place is: Gaza
event_breakdown:
- Fighter jets struck operational tunnel shafts, an anti-tank missile launch post, and terror infrastructure in northern Gaza.
- Troops identified terrorists at the launch location and fighter jets eliminated them.
- Two terrorists were identified advancing towards troops in central Gaza, and a fighter jet struck and eliminated one of them.
- Fighter jets struck Hezbollah terrorist infrastructure in Kfarkela and Khiam in southern Lebanon.

title: Ukraine updates : Russia strikes Odesa for 2nd time this week – DW – 05 / 01 / 2024
message:
Russia has pummeled the vital port city of Odesa, stepping up aerial attacks that have also damaged civilian infrastructure there, according to Ukrainian officials.
At least three people were killed and three more injured in a Russian missile strike on the Ukrainian city of Odesa in the early hours of Wednesday morning, local authorities said.
As a consequence of the attack, three people were killed and three more wounded," wrote Gennadiy Trukhanov, the mayor of the southwestern port city, on Telegram.
The attack comes just two days after Russian missiles struck an educational institution in the city, killing five people.
According to Shmyhal, Ukraine had previously earmarked 43.3 billion hryvnia for the purchase of drones this year.
event_breakdown:
- Russian missile strike on Odesa, Ukraine, killing at least three people and injuring three more
- Damage to civilian infrastructure in Odesa due to Russian aerial attacks
- Previous Russian missile strike on an educational institution in Odesa, killing five people

title: Israel Strikes Hamas Rocket Launchers , Tunnel Shafts , Hezbollah Infrastructure | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | Pesach Benson / TPS | 22 Nisan 5784 – Tuesday , April 30 , 2024
message:
Photo Credit: IDFIsraeli fighter jets struck operational tunnel shafts, an anti-tank missile launch post and Hamas terror infrastructure in northern and central Gaza, the Israel Defense Forces said on Tuesday morning.
Shortly afterward, fighter jets struck operational tunnel shafts, an anti-tank missile launch post and terror infrastructure in the area of northern Gaza from which the launch was identified.
Troops identified numerous terrorists at the location from which the launches were fired, and fighter jets struck and eliminated the terrorists.
Fighter jets struck the structure, eliminating the terrorist.
Also, fighter jets struck Hezbollah terrorist infrastructure in the areas of Kfarkela and Khiam in southern Lebanon.

2. Shortly afterward, fighter jets struck operational tunnel shafts, an anti-tank missile launch post, and terror infrastructure in the area of northern Gaza from which the launch was identified.

4. Fighter jets struck the structure, eliminating the terrorist.
5. Fighter jets struck Hezbollah terrorist infrastructure in the areas of Kfarkela and Khiam in southern Lebanon.

title: Somalia : Somali Government Condemns Killing of Hormuud Telecom Workers
message:
Mogadishu, Somalia — In a shocking and tragic turn of events, six employees of Hormuud Telecom, Somalia's largest telecommunications company, lost their lives in a roadside blast on the outskirts of Mogadishu, the country's capital on Sunday afternoon.
The government described the attack as a deliberate targeting, which is part of a series of attacks against commercial companies in Somalia.
This recent incident follows a pattern of targeted violence against Hormuud Telecom, with previous explosions destroying company branches and vehicles in Mogadishu and beyond.
Their loss has been deeply felt by the company and the broader community, with Hormuud Telecom expressing its deepest condolences to the families and friends of the victims.
As the investigation into the attack continues, the families of the victims and the entire Hormuud Telecom community mourn the loss of their colleagues, friends, and loved ones.
event_breakdown:
1. Six employees of Hormuud Telecom killed in roadside blast on outskirts of Mogadishu, Somalia
2. Government describes attack as deliberate targeting of commercial companies in Somalia
3. Pattern of targeted violence against Hormuud Telecom, with previous explosions in Mogadishu and beyond
4. Hormuud Telecom expresses condolences to families and friends of the victims
5. Investigation into the attack ongoing as families and community mourn the loss

title: My whole family has perished : 22 killed in Israeli airstrike on Rafah , hospital staff say
message:
Rafah, Gaza (CNN) — Editor’s Note: Warning: This story has graphic content.
Twenty-two people, including at least one infant and a toddler, have been killed in an Israeli airstrike over Rafah, Gaza, overnight into Monday, according to hospital officials.
Lifting the baby boy’s body to the camera, Mahmoud Abu Taha cries out, “this is who they are targeting.
Another member of the Abu Taha family says in the video that 10 of his relatives were killed in the airstrike.
Some of his relatives were originally displaced from Khan Younis, where several of them were killed in a previous Israeli airstrike.
event_breakdown:
- Israeli airstrike over Rafah, Gaza
- Israeli airstrike in Khan Younis

title: Sydney church stabbing : Teen alleged terrorism texts , claims he wanted to  kill non believers
message:
A 16-year-old boy charged with terrorism offences in connection with the Sydney church stabbing allegedly declared he was “going to kill” in messages about carrying out a plan against non-believers.
A 16-year-old boy charged with terrorism offences in connection with the Sydney church stabbing allegedly declared he was “going to kill” in messages about carrying out a plan against non-believers.
A 16-year-old boy charged with terrorism offences following the Sydney church stabbing allegedly sent text messages declaring he was “going to kill non-believers” before the attack was carried out by an alleged associate.
His alleged attacker was charged with terrorism offences, while four others, believed to be associates, were arrested following widespread search warrants.
A 16-year-old boy charged with terrorism offences in connection with the Sydney church stabbing allegedly declared he was “going to kill” in messages about carrying out a plan against non-believers.
event_breakdown:
- 16-year-old boy charged with terrorism offences in connection with Sydney church stabbing
- Boy allegedly declared he was “going to kill” non-believers in text messages
- Attack carried out by alleged associate of the boy
- Alleged attacker charged with terrorism offences
- Four associates arrested following search warrants

title: Russian missile hits educational institution , kills five in Ukraine Odesa
message:
ODESA, Ukraine (Reuters) -A Russian missile attack on an educational institution in a popular seafront park in the Ukrainian Black Sea port of Odesa on Monday killed at least five people and injured 32, local officials said.
Reuters Television footage showed the roof of the ornate building, a private law academy, all but destroyed after the strike.
I don't know what else to say," Odesa Mayor Hennadii Trukhanov said in a video posted on Telegram.
"In front of my eyes, a missile was shot down, this was just in front of me.
Odesa has been a frequent target of Russian missile and drone attacks, particular port infrastructure.
event_breakdown: - Russian missile attack on an educational institution in Odesa, Ukraine

title: Wakeley church stabbing : Teens allegedly discussed bombs , guns in group chats
message:
A group of teenagers discussed carrying out a terrorism attack and a desire to kill before they were arrested in anti-terrorism raids last Wednesday, a court has heard.
The conversations took place in group chats after the alleged stabbing of Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel during a live-streamed service at Christ the Good Shepherd Church in Wakeley on April 15.
The father of a teenager accused of stabbing a priest in a Wakeley church leaves Parramatta Children’s Court.
Credit: Janie BarrettNine days later, anti-terrorism police raided a dozen south-west suburbs and have arrested six young people, including a 16-year-old boy, who was charged with conspiring to prepare or plan for a terrorist act.
That 16-year-old has been in custody since his arrest a week ago and was refused bail at Parramatta Local Court on Tuesday by Magistrate Janet Wahlquist.
event_breakdown:
1. Alleged stabbing of Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel during a live-streamed service at Christ the Good Shepherd Church in Wakeley on April 15.
2. Group of teenagers discussing carrying out a terrorism attack and expressing a desire to kill in group chats.
3. Anti-terrorism police raid a dozen south-west suburbs and arrest six young people, including a 16-year-old boy charged with conspiring to prepare or plan for a terrorist act.

title: Missile attack by Yemen Houthi rebels damages a ship in Red Sea
message:
JERUSALEM -- A missile attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels damaged a ship in the Red Sea on Monday, April 29, 2024, authorities said, the latest assault in their campaign against shipping in the crucial maritime route.
The ship was damaged in the attack, the UKMTO said, though its crew was safe and heading to its next port of call.
Meanwhile Monday, the Italian Defense Ministry said its frigate Virgino Fasan shot down a Houthi drone that morning near the Bab el-Mandeb Strait between the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.
Shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden has declined because of the threat.
Early Sunday morning, the US military shot down five drones in the air over the Red Sea, its Central Command said.
event_breakdown:
- Missile attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels damages ship in Red Sea
- Italian frigate shoots down Houthi drone near Bab el-Mandeb Strait
- US military shoots down five drones over Red Sea

message:
ODESA, Ukraine - A Russian missile attack on an educational institution in a popular seafront park in the Ukrainian Black Sea port of Odesa on Monday killed at least five people and injured 32, local officials said.
Reuters Television footage showed the roof of the ornate building, a private law academy, all but destroyed after the strike.
I don't know what else to say," Odesa Mayor Hennadii Trukhanov said in a video posted on Telegram.
Public broadcaster Suspilne said the academy's president, a prominent former member of parliament, Serhiy Kivalov, was among the injured.

title: Houthi rebels attack two US destroyers in Red Sea with devastating drone strike | World | News
message:
Houthi rebels in Yemen have attacked two US destroyers and two vessels in the Red Sea with drone strikes.
Monday's attack happened off the coast of Mokha, Yemen, the British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The ship sustained damage in the attack, the UKMTO said, though its crew was safe and heading to its next port of call.
The agency urged vessels to exercise caution in the area.
“Vessel and crew are reported safe.”The Houthis did not immediately acknowledge any attack, though suspicion fell on the group.
event_breakdown:
- Houthi rebels in Yemen attacked two US destroyers and two vessels in the Red Sea with drone strikes off the coast of Mokha, Yemen
- The British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center reported the attack on Monday 
- The attacked ship sustained damage, but its crew was safe and heading to its next port of call 
- The UKMTO urged vessels to exercise caution in the area 
- The Houthis did not immediately acknowledge any attack, though suspicion fell on the group

message:

"After the ATACMS missiles were shot down, the undetonated submunitions scattered," he said, warning civilians not to touch or approach any unspent submunitions.
The U.S.-provided Army Tactical Missile System, known as ATACMS, has since been used to strikes targets in Russian-occupied territory.

title: Three killed as Russia attacks Odesa with ballistic missiles for the second day in a row
message:
Shattered widows in one of the residential buildings after Russian strike late in the evening on April 30Three people were killed and three others injured after Russia attacked Odesa with ballistic missiles on the evening of April 30, Odesa Governor Oleh Kiper said.
"Three people died in Odesa,” said Presidential Office head, Andriy Yermak, on the morning of May 1.
“Ballistic missiles hit a large, peaceful city at night.
Residential buildings were damaged as a result of the enemy's night attack - windows and doors were shattered, Odesa Mayor Hennadyi Trukhanov reported at 2:45 a.m. EET.
"Russia is launching ballistic missiles against us for the second day in a row.”He urged civilians to pay attention to air raid alarms and stay in shelters.
event_breakdown:

title: Russian missile kills three in Ukrainian port of Odesa
message:
A Russian missile attack killed three people and injured three others in the Ukrainian port of Odesa early on Wednesday, regional Governor Oleh Kiper said.
He said the strike was carried out by a ballistic missile, but provided no further details.
Kiper and Odesa Mayor Hennadii Trukhanov had reported a series of loud explosions.
On Monday, a Russian missile struck an educational institution in the city, killing five people.
Odesa has been a frequent target of Russian forces in the more than two-year-old war, with many attacks aimed at the city's port facilities.
event_breakdown:
- A Russian missile attack in the Ukrainian port of Odesa killed three people and injured three others.
- The strike was carried out by a ballistic missile, according to regional Governor Oleh Kiper.
- Odesa Governor Oleh Kiper and Mayor Hennadii Trukhanov reported a series of loud explosions.
- Earlier on Monday, a Russian missile struck an educational institution in the city, resulting in the death of five people.
- Odesa has been repeatedly targeted by Russian forces in the ongoing conflict, with many attacks focusing on the city's port facilities.

message:

Meanwhile Monday, the Italian Defense Ministry said its frigate Virgino Fasan shot down a Houthi drone that morning near the Bab el-Mandeb Strait between the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.

Early Sunday morning, the U.S. military shot down five drones in the air over the Red Sea, its Central Command said.

title: Joining Forces Against Terrorism : Japan New Law Commits More ThanWords to U . S . Effort
message:
By moving beyond the country's prior policy of non-involvement, the law will allow Japan's self-defense forces (SDF) to support the efforts of the U.S. forces in Afghanistan.
For Japan, this new approach means the Diet must amend the laws governing the self-defense forces and the Maritime Safety Agency.
Therefore, the Administration should support Japan through active diplomacy around the Asia-Pacific region and through its own "proactive" public diplomacy program.
Finally, when Japan's self-defense forces do deploy, they should be fully integrated into the defense architecture in regions where the war on terrorism is being waged.
By passing the anti-terrorism law, permitting Japan's self-defense forces to deploy to the Persian Gulf, the Diet has greatly aided Prime Minister Koizumi's effort to develop a new consensus in Japan on collective self-defense.
event_breakdown:
- Japan's self-defense forces (SDF) will support U.S. forces in Afghanistan, marking a departure from the country's previous policy of non-involvement.
- The Japanese Diet must amend laws governing the self-defense forces and the Maritime Safety Agency to accommodate this new approach.
- The administration is urged to support Japan through active diplomacy in the Asia-Pacific region and a "proactive" public diplomacy program.
- Japan's self-defense forces, when deployed, should be fully integrated into defense architectures in regions combating terrorism.
- The passage of the anti-terrorism law allows Japan's self-defense forces to deploy to the Persian Gulf, aiding Prime Minister Koizumi's efforts to establish a new consensus on collective self-defense in Japan.

title: Accused teen linked to Sydney bishop stabbing applies for release from custody
message:
A 15-year-old boy who claims to be a friend of the teen accused of stabbing a Sydney bishop recently has applied to be released from custody on bailAccused teen linked to Sydney bishop's stabbing applies for release from custodyBy The Associated PressSYDNEY -- A 15-year-old boy who claimed to be a friend of a teen accused of stabbing a Sydney bishop applied Wednesday to be released from custody on bail on a charge of planning a terrorist attack.
The 15-year-old is one of six teens, ages 14 to 17, who were charged in a Sydney court last week with a range of offenses including conspiring to engage in or planning a terrorist act.
Dib tendered a bundle of documents including an affidavit from the boy’s mother, school report cards and a psychological report.
“A young person with behavioral issues facing a terrorism accusation is not exceptional, it is rather the norm,” Rodger said.
The boy had been part of an encrypted chat group titled “Plans” where he talked about targeting Jewish people, Rodger said.
event_breakdown:
- A 15-year-old boy, linked to the stabbing of a Sydney bishop, applies for release from custody on bail
- The boy is one of six teens, ages 14 to 17, charged in a Sydney court for conspiring to engage in or planning a terrorist act
- Documents including an affidavit from the boy's mother, school report cards, and a psychological report are tendered
- Rodger states that it is not exceptional for a young person with behavioral issues to face a terrorism accusation
- The boy had participated in an encrypted chat group called "Plans" where he discussed targeting Jewish people

title: Middle East Totters on the Edge of a Cliff as two Arch enemies Confront Each Other
message:
Syria movesto the centre stageof conflict betweenIsrael and IranBy James M DorseyMultiple overt and covert wars have pushed the Middle East to the edge of a cliff.
Increased tension between Iran and Israel complicates efforts to pull the Middle East back from the abyss.
With the two archenemies walking a fine line between waging covert or overt war, escalation between Israel and Iran has the greatest potential to push the Middle East off the cliff.
The US and Israeli denials followed a series of tit-for-tat attacks that threatened to suck Israel, Iran, and potentially the United States into an all-out Middle East war.
The Gaza war moved Syria centrestage in the covert Israeli-Iranian confrontation.
event_breakdown:
- Increased tension between Iran and Israel complicates efforts to stabilize the Middle East.
- The potential for escalation between Israel and Iran poses a significant risk to regional stability.
- Denials from the US and Israel followed a series of tit-for-tat attacks, raising the specter of a broader Middle East conflict.
- Increased tension between Iran and Israel
- Ongoing covert and overt wars in the Middle East
- Gaza war
- Syria becoming central stage in Israeli-Iranian confrontation
- Threat of all-out war between Israel, Iran, and potentially the United States

title: Five killed in Russian missile attack as Ukraine  Harry Potter castle  goes up in flames
message:
At least five people were killed and more than 30 injured in a Russian missile attack on the Black Sea port city of Odesa on Monday, Ukrainian authorities say.
Ukrainian authorities believe Russia used an Iskander ballistic missile and cluster munitions to carry out the attack.
He added that “the investigation has grounds to believe” the Russian military used cluster munitions with the intention of inflicting large number of casualties.
The use, transfer, and production of cluster munitions is prohibited by an international treaty known as the Convention on Cluster Munitions.
Russia claims interceptMeanwhile, Russian officials say air defenses in Crimea succeeded in intercepting a major missile and drone attack by Ukraine.
event_breakdown:
- A Russian missile attack on the Black Sea port city of Odesa resulted in at least five deaths and more than 30 injuries.
- Ukrainian authorities suspect Russia used an Iskander ballistic missile and cluster munitions in the attack.
- The investigation suggests that the Russian military intentionally used cluster munitions to cause significant casualties.
- The use, transfer, and production of cluster munitions are prohibited by the Convention on Cluster Munitions, an international treaty.
- Russian officials claim that air defenses in Crimea intercepted a significant missile and drone attack by Ukraine.

message:
CNN —At least five people were killed and more than 30 injured in a Russian missile attack on the Black Sea port city of Odesa on Monday, Ukrainian authorities say.
Ukrainian authorities believe Russia used an Iskander ballistic missile and cluster munitions to carry out the attack.

title: Portuguese - flagged ship is hit far in Arabian Sea , raising concerns over Houthi rebel capabilities
message:
JERUSALEM — A Portuguese-flagged container ship came under attack by a drone in the far reaches of the Arabian Sea, corresponding with a claim by Yemen's Houthi rebels that they assaulted the ship there, authorities said Tuesday.
The MSC Orion has been associated with London-based Zodiac Maritime, which is part of Israeli billionaire Eyal Ofer's Zodiac Group.
The Joint Maritime Information Center assesses ''that MSC Orion was likely targeted due to (its) perceived Israeli affiliation,'' the center said in a report.
Those are close to Yemen's shoreline — unlike the site of the MSC Orion attack.
On Tuesday, the rebels released footage of their drone attack on the Cyclades, a Malta-flagged, Greece-owned bulk carrier, the day before.
event_breakdown:
- Portuguese-flagged container ship attacked by a drone in the Arabian Sea
- Claim by Yemen's Houthi rebels of assaulting the Portuguese-flagged container ship
- The MSC Orion linked to London-based Zodiac Maritime, part of the Zodiac Group
- Joint Maritime Information Center's assessment of the attack on MSC Orion
- Rebels released footage of their drone attack on the Cyclades in the Arabian Sea

title: Suspected missile attack by Yemen Houthi rebels damages ship in the Red Sea : authorities
message:
Open this photo in gallery: Yemen's capital Sana'a is seen on a map.The Associated PressA suspected missile attack by Yemen’s Houthi rebels damaged a ship in the Red Sea on Monday, authorities said, the latest assault in their campaign against international shipping in the crucial maritime route.
Meanwhile Monday, the Italian Defence Ministry said its frigate Virginio Fasan shot down a Houthi drone that morning near the Bab el-Mandeb Strait between the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.
Houthi attacks have dropped in recent weeks as the rebels have been targeted by a U.S.-led air strike campaign in Yemen.
Shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden has declined because of the threat.
Early Sunday morning, the U.S. military shot down five drones in the air over the Red Sea, its Central Command said.
event_breakdown:
- Suspected missile attack by Yemen’s Houthi rebels damaging a ship in the Red Sea
- Italian frigate shooting down a Houthi drone near the Bab el-Mandeb Strait
- Decline in Houthi attacks due to U.S.-led air strike campaign in Yemen
- Reduction in shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden due to the threat
- U.S. military shooting down five drones over the Red Sea

title: Hamas alleges rocket barrage from Lebanon into northern Israel
message:
On Monday, the Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades, the military wing of Hamas, launched a series of rockets from southern Lebanon targeting a northern Israeli military command center.
In response, the Israeli military reported intercepting most of the approximately 20 rockets launched from Lebanon and conducted strikes on the launch sites.
Following the rocket barrage, an Israeli drone struck the town of Aita al-Shaab in southern Lebanon.
Earlier in the year, a U.S.-reported Israeli strike in January killed Hamas’ deputy leader Saleh al-Arouri and six militants in south Beirut, a Hezbollah stronghold.
In March, another Israeli strike killed a Hamas operative near the Rashidiyeh Palestinian refugee camp in Tyre, while a Hamas official narrowly escaped a drone strike near Souairi in the Bekaa Valley.
event_breakdown:
- Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades launched rockets from southern Lebanon targeting an Israeli military command center
- Israeli military intercepted most rockets and conducted strikes on launch sites in response
- Israeli drone struck town of Aita al-Shaab in southern Lebanon
- U.S.-reported Israeli strike in January killed Hamas' deputy leader Saleh al-Arouri and six militants in south Beirut
- Israeli strike in March killed a Hamas operative near Rashidiyeh Palestinian refugee camp in Tyre
- Hamas official narrowly escaped a drone strike near Souairi in the Bekaa Valley

title: Trump tells Nato  youre on your own  if they dont increase spending
message:
Donald Trump has warned Nato members they will be on their “own” unless they increase their defence spending if he wins a second term.
Earlier this year, he went further in suggesting Russia could “do whatever the hell they want” to Nato allies who did not spend enough on collective defence.
When it comes to the Middle East, Mr Trump said he would defend Israel if the country was attacked by Iran.
The Estonian foreign minister said it will take up the matter with its NATO and European Union partners.
Mr Demchenko said that since the start of the war border guards have uncovered about 450 criminal groups that have attempted to smuggle people across the border.
event_breakdown:
- Donald Trump warns NATO members about defense spending
- Donald Trump suggests Russia could act against NATO allies
- Donald Trump pledges to defend Israel against an attack by Iran
- Estonian foreign minister to discuss matter with NATO and EU partners
- Border guards uncover 450 criminal groups trying to smuggle people across the border

title: Russian missile hits educational institution , kills five in Ukraine Odesa – The Times Of Earth
message:
By Iryna Nazarchuk ReutersA Russian missile attack on an educational institution in a popular seafront park in the Ukrainian Black Sea port of Odesa on Monday killed at least five people and injured 32, local officials said.
Reuters Television footage showed the roof of the ornate building, a private law academy, all but destroyed after the strike.
I don’t know what else to say,” Odesa Mayor Hennadii Trukhanov said in a video posted on Telegram.
Public broadcaster Suspilne said the academy’s president, a prominent former member of parliament, Serhiy Kivalov, was among the injured.
Odesa has been a frequent target of Russian missile and drone attacks, particular port infrastructure.
event_breakdown:
- Russian missile attack on an educational institution in Odesa, Ukraine
- Attack killed at least five people and injured 32
- The targeted building was a private law academy 
- Odesa Mayor Hennadii Trukhanov expressed shock and disbelief
- The academy’s president, Serhiy Kivalov, was among the injured
- Odesa has been a frequent target of Russian missile and drone attacks, particularly port infrastructure

title: Prosecutors say teen charged in Sydney church stabbing plotted attack on Jewish community
message:
Prosecutors in Australia said Wednesday that a 15-year-old boy charged along with other teens in a stabbing at a church in Sydney plotted an attack against the Jewish community.
Photo by Bianca De Marchi/EPA-EFEMay 1 (UPI) -- Australian prosecutors argued on Wednesday that a 15-year-old involved in a stabbing at a Sydney court wanted to attack Jewish community members but his attorney said his talk was nothing more than boasting.
The revelations came during a hearing where a judge was determining whether to release the youth on bail.
The Joint Counter Terrorism Team arrested the boy and others connected to the April 15 stabbing attack on Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel and three others inside a church at Wakeley in western Sydney.
"I want to do it to a bunch of Jews," the boy said on a group chat on April 20, according to prosecutors.
event_breakdown: null

title: The Latest | Hamas officials leave Cairo after talks with Egypt officials over cease - fire proposal – The Durango Herald
message:
×Officials from Hamas have left Cairo after talks with Egyptian officials on a new proposal for a cease-fire in Gaza, Egypt’s state-owned Al-Qahera News satellite channel said Tuesday.
The channel, which has close ties with Egyptian security agencies, said a Hamas delegation will return to Cairo with a written response to the cease-fire proposal, without saying when.
Currently:— Ahead of visit to Israel, Blinken presses Hamas to accept the new cease-fire proposal.
HAMAS DELEGATION LEAVES CAIRO AFTER CEASE-FIRE TALKSCAIRO — Officials from Hamas have left Cairo after talks with Egyptian officials on a new cease-fire proposal in Gaza, Egypt’s state-owned Al-Qahera News satellite channel said Tuesday.
The channel, which has close ties with Egyptian security agencies, said a Hamas delegation will return to Cairo with a written response to the cease-fire proposal, without saying when.
event_breakdown:
- Hamas delegation leaves Cairo after cease-fire talks
- Blinken presses Hamas to accept new cease-fire proposal

title: Sydney teenager charged after counter - terrorism raids texted  were going to kill , court hears | Australia news
message:
A 16-year-old Sydney boy charged with terrorism offences has been denied bail over fears for community safety after a court heard he messaged another young person “we’re going to kill”.
Six teenagers were charged after counter-terrorism raids in Sydney last week, with two of them appearing in the children’s court at Parramatta on Tuesday.
“We were planning big stuff bro, it’s conspiracy for a terrorist attack I think,” the court heard he wrote in a text message.
The court heard the 16-year-old’s parents, who were present for the hearing, wrote an affidavit describing an “excellent son” who was a good student.
The material allegedly included a video of an assault with the Islamic State symbol watermarked over the video.
event_breakdown:
- A 16-year-old Sydney boy charged with terrorism offences denied bail over safety concerns
- Six teenagers charged after counter-terrorism raids in Sydney
- Two teenagers appeared in children's court at Parramatta
- Court heard message from 16-year-old about planning a terrorist attack
- Parents of the 16-year-old described him as an "excellent son" and good student
- Material allegedly included a video of an assault with Islamic State symbol watermarked

title: Expect accountability from India ...: US reacts to Washington Post article on Pannun murder plot
message:
The Indian government has designated Pannun as a terrorist.
The US spokesperson also spoke about Israel’s ‘imminent’ Rafah operation, saying that Washington has not yet seen a credible plan that would address the varying areas of concerns.
It’s an area that continues to be an important conduit for humanitarian aid, as well as safe departure for foreign nationals.
So any kind of operation that does not address some of these key concerns would certainly be opposed by us,” said Patel.
AdvertisementHe said that the US is continuously engaging with its partners in Israel and is having conversations at all levels.
event_breakdown:
- The Indian government designates Pannun as a terrorist.
- US spokesperson comments on Israel's 'imminent' Rafah operation, stating lack of credible plan to address concerns.
- Area serves as conduit for humanitarian aid and safe departure for foreign nationals.
- Patel highlights opposition to operations not addressing key concerns, stresses ongoing engagement with partners in Israel.
